item.title: If a Jagex mod reads this, please message me
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Writer: Hey, boss, for my column this week I want to write an article about the theft of some imaginary weapons and armor from a roleplaying game, on the internet, what do you think?

Editor: Hmmm, I don’t know. That sounds like total bullshit. But, we are showing good numbers in the total bullshit interest group. Serve it up, homeboy.

Read full topic

Timmy says "I cant speak for myslef" Timmy says "I have no life" Timmy says "I look like this guy": [img]http://i191.photobucket.com/albums/z214/AllAboutLee/Flash/TimmyV.gif[/img] He really does look like Timmy from South Park Well screw him, Buying RS gold is against the rules in the first place so Jagex should ignore this

item.title: If a Jagex mod reads this, please message me
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:6, topic:257855”]1) He spent $140 on “swords and armour” - Real World Trading.
2) Under the minimum age. He’s 11 when he should be at least 13.
3) He and only he gave the hacker access to the account, and wasn’t careful himself when he logged onto the phishing site (didn’t notice URL, etc.)

Him and his own parents are idiots for (so basically who gets the blame):

  1. Not reading the rules
  2. He fell for the trap
  3. His parents weren’t supervising his actions like they were supposed to be

And finally, Joe Ducey (the reporter) is an idiot for not “investigating” this.[/quote]It wasn’t a parent, its a grandparent lol…

Read full topic
